Second.  Stop all the total elimination nonsense.  Eliminating fossil fuel is and will cause tremendous problems throughout the world. It is already happening.
Instead, invest in improving and scaling up the technology that allows the removal of carbon dioxide from the air and replaces it with oxygen. Really?  Are you sure?  I love how science teaches this stuff as if it's carved in stone fact, and then someone makes a discovery that reveals their first "truths" about the subject were completely wrong, and now they have a new truth.  Now, the new truth, is the only truth, and if you dispute it, you are a heretic of sorts.  You remain the heretic until, of course, someone discovers new facts, and the most recent new truth suddenly becomes antiquated and wrong and now we have another new truth.  This just recently happened with the Big Bang theory.  Through the use of the new James Webb Space Telescope, scientists have discovered startling evidence that the far away galaxies exhibit characteristics that contradict a big-bang event ever occurring.  In essence, the new truth debunks the big-bang theory, and it has scientists literally panicking.  The same thing happened to the evolution theory.  Science still teaches it as if it is absolute fact and truth, yet through our modern understanding of DNA, we now know that the evolution model is false.  We now know that micro evolution is possible, but macro evolution never takes place.  In other words, a finches' beak may change to adapt to a different food source, but it's still a finch, it's still a bird; however, a fish can never leave the water and become a mammal no matter how much time you give it to do so.
